Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Divorce \Di*vorce"\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Divorced}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Divorcing}.] [Cf. F. divorcer. See {Divorce}, n.] 1. To dissolve the marriage contract of, either wholly or partially; to separate by divorce. [1913 Webster]
2. To separate or disunite; to sunder. [1913 Webster]
It [a word] was divorced from its old sense. --Earle. [1913 Webster]
3. To make away; to put away. [1913 Webster]
Nothing but death Shall e'er divorce my dignities. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
